title: Echoes by the Archon's Gaze
setting_narration: The evening sun casts long shadows across the majestic Statue of the Seven, bathing the stone in a soft, golden glow. A gentle breeze whispers through Mondstadt, carrying the faint scent of cecilias. Eula stands with her back to the city, her gaze fixed on the Archon's serene face, while Amber approaches with a thoughtful expression.

segments.text: Amber walks up beside Eula, leaning slightly against the cold stone base of the statue. Eula remains still, her expression unreadable.

segments.speaker: Amber
segments.line: It's peaceful here, isn't it? Makes you think about... everything.

segments.speaker: Eula
segments.line: Indeed. A fitting place for quiet contemplation. Or perhaps, quiet regret.

segments.text: Amber glances at Eula, a flicker of understanding in her eyes. She knows Eula isn't one for idle laments.

segments.speaker: Amber
segments.line: Regret? Are you thinking about... past attachments?

segments.speaker: Eula
segments.line: Even the coldest of hearts can hold embers of what once was. It's a foolish sentiment, perhaps, but one that persists.

segments.text: Amber hums thoughtfully, looking out over the city of Mondstadt as the first stars begin to appear.

segments.speaker: Amber
segments.line: I know what you mean. Sometimes I wonder if I ever truly moved on, or just... kept moving forward, you know?

segments.speaker: Eula
segments.expression_action: (finally turning slightly towards Amber, a rare hint of vulnerability)
segments.line: Such memories can be a formidable foe, yet also a silent strength. A paradox, like many things in this world.

segments.text: A comfortable silence settles between them, punctuated only by the distant sounds of Mondstadt. For a moment, two very different women find common ground in shared human experience.

segments.speaker: Amber
segments.line: Well, whatever those memories hold, it means we lived, right? We felt something real.

segments.speaker: Eula
segments.line: My thanks, Outrider. Your perspective is... unexpectedly grounding.
